b61.title: Phosphoinositide 3-Kinase Regulates Glycolysis through Mobilization of Aldolase from the Actin Cytoskeleton
b61.reason: This study demonstrates a new mode of regulation of glycolytic flux by PI3K through an AKT-independent, RAC-dependent mechanism involving cytoskeletal remodelling and release of actin

b157.title: Antioxidant and oncogene rescue of metabolic defects caused by loss of matrix attachment
b157.reason: This study demonstrates that treatment with antioxidants or activation of oncogenes such as ERBB2, PIK3CA or AKT can rescue ROS-induced cell death caused by detachment of mammary cells from the extracellular matrix

b178.title: Nrf2 Redirects Glucose and Glutamine into Anabolic Pathways in Metabolic Reprogramming
b178.reason: This study demonstrates that the PI3K-AKT pathway promotes nuclear accumulation of NRF2, which stimulates flux into the pentose phosphate pathway and nucleotide synthesis in proliferating cells
